author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: O’Chang hosts ‘Temp Tales’ premiere
text:
O’Chang hosts ‘Temp Tales’ premiere Oct 13, 2015 The Mallett Brothers Band makes an appearance in the latest “Temp Tales” cartoon from the Midcoast’s O’Chang Comics, along with the series' familiar faces. 
Rockport — The local animators of O’Chang Comics will screen their brand-new “Temp Tales” cartoon “Crittah Gittahz II” Friday night, Oct. 23, at the Simonton Corner Community Hall, 366 Main St. 
The full evening will begin at 7 p.m. and also includes live music by local bands The Midnight Riders and Sugar Bush, along with standup comedy by Portland's Ian Stuart and hometown comedian Janis Lilly. 
“Temp Tales” creators Hanji and Atom O’Chang will be in attendance to meet fans and take ideas for future episodes. “Temp Tales” follows the adventures of island painter Green Bud Kelly and his hipster assistant Atom as they scrape together whatever work they can find — from taking care of the seasonal homes of snooty summer folks to hunting down zombie seals and growing pot. 
Since the duo's first episode, “Meat Recall,” went viral in 2013, O’Chang Studios has released 11 “Temp Tales” shorts and two educational cartoons that collectively have received more than 1.8 million views on YouTube. “Crittah Gittahz II” follows up last year’s episode “Crittah Gittahz” and features a cameo by Maine’s own The Mallett Brothers Band. 
Suggested donation is $5 to $10, to cover hall rental. Simonton Corner Community Hall is just off the corner of Main and Park streets. For more information, call 542-4728. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
